param.name: reference_source_selector
param.label: Choose the source for the reference genome

param.name: perform_indel_calling_selector
param.label: Perform INDEL calling
param.option: Perform INDEL calling using default options
Perform INDEL calling and set advanced options

param.name: gap_open_sequencing_error_probability
param.label: Phred-scaled gap open sequencing error probability
param.help: --open-prob; Reducing this value leads to more indel calls; default=40

param.name: gap_extension_sequencing_error_probability
param.label: Phred-scaled gap extension sequencing error probability
param.help: --ext-prob; Reducing this value leads to longer indels. default=20

param.name: skip_indel_calling_above_sample_depth
param.label: Skip INDEL calling if the average per-sample depth is above

param.name: minimum_gapped_reads_for_indel_candidates
param.label: Minimum gapped reads for indel candidates

param.name: open_seq_error_probability
param.label: Phred-scaled gap open sequencing error probability
param.help: --open-prob; Reducing this value leads to more indel calls; default=40

param.name: gapped_read_per_sample
param.label: Apply --min-ireads and --gap-frac values on a per-sample basis
param.help: --per-sample-mF; by default both options are applied to reads pooled from all samples

param.name: platform_entry
param.label: Platform to use for INDEL candidates
param.help: It is recommended to collect indel candidates from sequencing technologies that have low indel error rate such as ILLUMINA

param.name: skip_anomalous_read_pairs
param.label: Do not skip anomalous read pairs in variant calling

param.name: filter_flags
param.label: Set filter by flags
param.option: Filter by flags to exclude or require

param.label: Quality Options
param.name: quality_settings
param.option: Set base and mapping quality options

param.name: baq
param.label: per-Base Alignment Quality
param.help: --no-BAQ; BAQ is the Phred-scaled probability of a read base being misaligned. Applying this option greatly helps to reduce false SNPs caused by misalignments. --redo-BAQ; ignore existing BQ tags
param.option: recalculate BAQ on the fly, ignore existing BQs (redo-BAQ)

param.name: coefficient_for_downgrading
param.label: Coefficient for downgrading mapping quality for reads containing excessive mismatches
param.help: --adjust-MQ; Given a read with a phred-scaled probability q of being generated from the mapped position, the new mapping quality is about sqrt((INT-q)/INT)*INT. A zero value disables this functionality; if enabled, the recommended value for BWA is 50. default=0

param.label: Minimum mapping quality for an alignment to be used
param.name: minimum_mapping_quality
minimum_base_quality
param.label: Minimum base quality for a base to be considered

param.name: read_groups_selector
param.label: Select read groups to include or exclude
param.option: Paste a list of read groups
Ignore RG tags. Treat all reads in one alignment file as one sample.

param.name: rg_action
param.label: Include or Exclude these Read Groups

param.name: group_paste
param.label: Read groups
param.help: Paste a list of read groups

param.name: rg_action
param.label: Include or Exclude these Read Groups

param.name: output_tags
param.label: Optional tags to output
param.option: ADF (Allelic depth on the forward strand)
ADR (Allelic depth on the reverse strand)
INFO/ADF (Allelic depth on the forward strand)
INFO/ADR (Allelic depth on the reverse strand)
DP4 (Number of high-quality ref-forward, ref-reverse, alt-forward and alt-reverse bases)
DRP (Number of high-quality bases for each observed allele)
INFO/DPR (Number of high-quality bases for each observed allele)

param.name: gvcf
param.label: gVCF blocks of homozygous REF calls
param.help: output gVCF blocks of homozygous REF calls, with depth (DP) ranges specified by the list of integers. For example, passing 5,15 will group sites into two types of gVCF blocks, the first with minimum per-sample DP from the interval [5,15) and the latter with minimum depth 15 or more. In this example, sites with minimum per-sample depth less than 5 will be printed as separate records, outside of gVCF blocks.
